text: Girella leonina is a species of sea chubs in the family Kyphosidae, native to the Western Central Pacific in areas from Hong Kong to Japan, in waters 1 to 15 meters (3-49 ft) deep, in shallow rocky reefs. == Description and feeding == It grows up to 46 centimeters in length with a blackish coloring, and its diet is made up of plants and prymnesiophyceae. == References == Category:Fish described in 1846 leonina Category:Fish of Japan Category:Fish of the Pacific Ocean
title: Girella leonina
